generif.text: Chemerin is a chemotactic agent and ligand of CMKLR1 (ChemR23).  The CMKLR1/chemerin axis may play a key role in directing plasmacytoid monocyte-derived dendritic cell trafficking.
degranulated PMNs release proteases that efficiently convert prochemerin into active chemerin
chemerin is activated by serine proteases of the coagulation, fibrinolytic, and inflammatory cascades
chemerin is a novel adipose-derived signaling molecule that regulates adipogenesis and adipocyte metabolism
These data establish that chemerin is a novel adipokine that regulates adipocyte function.
Results identify chemerin as a natural nonsignaling protein ligand for both human and mouse CCRL2.
TIG2-protein and transcript were detected in all layers of normal epidermis and uninvolved skin adjacent to SCC lesions.
circulating carboxypeptidase N/ carboxypeptidase B and platelets may potentially contribute to regulating the bioactivity of leukocyte chemoattractant chemerin
Chemerin expression specifically marks the early phases of evolving skin psoriatic lesions and is temporally strictly associated with plasmacytoid dendritic cells.

Magnetic resonance imaging-quantified visceral fat mass was associated with RARRES2 SNP rs17173608 and nominally associated with RARRES2 SNP rs10278590 in nonobese subjects, with carriers of the minor alleles displaying lower visceral adipose tissue mass
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Epithelial cells in fetal intestine produce chemerin to recruit macrophages.
Circulating chemerin levels were associated with metabolic syndrome phenotypes in a second, unrelated human population.
differences in the distribution of NK cells and pDC in skin lesions suggest that recruitment of both NK cells and pDC is unlikely to be controlled solely by chemerin
Elevated systemic levels of chemerin in obesity and type 2 diabetes seem to be associated with inflammation rather than body mass index.
Circulating levels of chemerin are higher in ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease.

Adipocyte-derived secretion of chemerin may be involved in the negative cross talk between adipose tissue and skeletal muscle contributing to the negative relationship between obesity and insulin sensitivity.
Data demonstrate that markers of renal function are independently related to circulating chemerin levels.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Serum chemerin concentration was significantly higher in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease patients.
Plasma chemerin levels are significantly heritable and are identify a novel role for chemerin as a stimulator of angiogenesis.
This study suggests that chemerin might mediate metabolic alterations in obesity, drastically improving after gastric bypass.
Observational study and meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
potential link of chemerin with the pathogenesis of insulin resistance, obesity, and metabolic syndrome

The dual role of chemerin in inflammation and metabolism might provide a link between chronic inflammation and obesity, as well as obesity-related disorders such as type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
Elevated systemic levels of chemerin and leptin in psoriasis seem to be associated not only with metabolic syndrome risk factors but also with psoriasis.
Data show that comparing to T2D the IFG subjects had higher serum chemerin, progranulin, fetuin-A and RBP4 levels which was not detectable in the comparison of the T2D and IGT group.
Serum chemerin levels are strongly associated with renal function in diabetic patients.
These results demonstrate that human chondrocytes express both the receptor ChemR23 and the ligand chemerin...which may play pivotal roles in joint inflammation.
The ChemR23/Chemerin axis may have a role in the recruitment of dendritic cells within the kidney in patients affected by lupus nephritis.
maternal chemerin serum concentrations are significantly increased in preeclampsia during and after pregnancy
Serum chemerin levels were significantly elevated in metabolic syndrome patients with coronary artery disease (CAD) compared to in those without CAD and healthy subjects.
Cathepsin L- and K-cleaved chemerin trigger robust migration of human blood-derived plasmacytoid dendritic cells ex vivo
Data indicating a possible role of leptin, adiponectin, visfatin, chemerin and vaspin in the pathogenesis of chronic hepatitis are summarized.
Chemerin may be a mediator that links visceral obesity to cardiovascular risk factors.
chemerin undergoes extensive proteolytic processing in vivo, underlining the importance of measuring individual isoforms.
the necessity of appropriate C-terminal proteolytic processing to generate the likely physiologic form of active chemerin, chem157S, and suggested a possible role in malignant GBM.
Chemerin and ChemR23 were highly expressed in the rheumatoid arthritis synovium compared with osteoarthritis.
Expressions of chemerin mRNA and protein are significantly higher in epicardial adipose tissue of Han Chinese patients who have atherosclerosis.
Human synovial fibroblasts express both chemerin and its receptor. Chemerin enhanced expression of TLR4 and induced release of CCL2 in synovial fibroblasts.
Data suggest that serum chemerin levels are increased with increases in the number of diseased vessels in subjects with coronary artery disease in China.
High circulating chemerin level is correlated with arterial stiffness.
Chemerin levels are significantly increased in preeclampsia and independently associated with markers of dyslipidemia and with the severity of the preeclampsia
Reduced chemerin expression and serum concentration may contribute to improved insulin sensitivity and subclinical inflammation beyond significant weight
Chemerin expression was lower in hepatocellular carcinoma & correlated with tumor size, grade, DC & NK infiltration, & survival.
the rise of plasma levels of chemerin and VEGF, and their positive correlation with ankle/brachial index in diabetic peripheral vascular disease
detected in cytoplasm of third trimester placental cytotrophoblast and Hofbauer's cells

Data suggest association of serum chemerin level with obesity and vascular inflammation; data support role for chemerin as molecular link between increasing fat mass, insulin resistance, and early atherogenic risk profile in obese children.
Chronic ethanol consumption dose-dependently increases the chemerin levels in the serum and visceral adipose tissue.

Chemerin reduces insulin-like growth factor-1(IGF-1)-induced steroidogenesis and cell proliferation through a decrease in the activation of IGF-1 receptor signalling pathways in primary human granulosa cells
At the time of term Caesarean section, preexisting maternal obesity, and its associated insulin resistance, is associated with higher cord plasma chemerin concentrations.
fat depot-specific differential regulation of chemerin mRNA expression might contribute to the distinctive roles of subcutaneous vs. visceral adipose tissue in human obesity.
review of current research on biological roles of chemerin and chemokine-like receptor 1; highlight roles in mediating obesity and development of type 2 diabetes [REVIEW]
the present study has shown that chemerin plays an inhibitory role on inflammatory state of vascular endothelial cells.

These results rule out the direct anti-inflammatory effect of chemerin on macrophages ex vivo, described previously in the literature, despite the expression of a functional ChemR23 receptor in these cells.
Elevated serum chemerin levels are associated with the presence of coronary artery disease in patients with type 2 diabetes.
Our data indicate that chemerin is up-regulated during decidualization and might contribute to natural killer cell accumulation and vascular remodeling during early pregnancy.
Serum fetuin A levels were higher in prevalent hepatic steatosis patients with hepatic steatosis, and positively correlated with chemerin levels
data suggest that increased chemerin levels are associated with the presence of coronary artery disease and that serum chemerin levels may reflect the extent of coronary atherosclerosis.
Cord blood chemerin was present in cord blood and its concentrations were positively correlated with birthweight. These novel findings support a role of adipokines in fetal growth.
Finding showed positive association between chemerin rs17173608 polymorphism and risk of Metabolic syndrome (MeS) (chi(2)=7.70, p=0.021) in Zahedan, southeast Iran.
These results suggest the role of chemerin in sex dimorphism and a potential link between chemerin levels and type two diabetes mellitus pathogenesis in a Japanese population.
studies show that mitochondrial ROS are important for autophagy in chemerin-induced angiogenesis and that targeting autophagy may provide an important new tool for treating cardiovascular disease
Serum chemerin concentrations correlated with BMI, whereas chemerin mRNA levels in adipose tissue did not.
chemerin (p<0.01) and leptin (p<0.01) were significantly decreased after fasting. For leptin, this decrease was also significant after 36 h (p<0.01). Adiponectin levels remained unchanged.

We make the novel observation of abnormal circulating and gluteal fat-secreted chemerin and omentin-1 levels in nascent metabolic syndrome, which could confer a higher risk for diabetes and cardiovascular disease.

Prochemerin processing protease converts prochemerin into active chemerinF; the activating truncation by the protease might trigger a structural C-terminal rearrangement leading to increased affinity of chemerin to chemokine-like receptor (CMKLR)1.
Chemerin, a novel target gene of FXR, is related to nonalcoholic steatohepatitis.

Using a panel of overlapping chemerin-derived synthetic peptides, we demonstrate that the antibacterial activity of chemerin is primarily mediated by Val(66)-Pro(85), which causes direct bacterial lysis.
These data support a new role for chemerin as an endogenous vasoconstrictor that operates through a receptor typically attributed to function only in immune cells.
serum chemerin decrease is associated with improved insulin sensitivity, and may be involved in the beneficial effects of lifestyle intervention in overweight and obese type 2 diabetic patients
Chemerin does not display a day/night variation, while acute energy deprivation resulted in a significant drop in circulating chemerin levels.
conclusion current data show that primary human hepatocytes are a major source of hepatic chemerin and increased liver chemerin in non-alcoholic steatohepatitis
chemerin mRNA expression is significantly elevated in the liver of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis patients

Serum chemerin is significantly higher in gastric cancer patients than healthy subjects.
increased during normal gestation and is associated with maternal body mass index and insulin resistance
Plasma chemerin levels are correlated with obesity, blood pressure, and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, suggesting that it may play a role in the pathogenesis of metabolic syndrome.
cathepsin S and chemerin only correlated positively with insulin resistance and inflammation

Data suggest that adiposity is main determinant of up-regulation of chemerin/RARRES2 and down-regulation of omentin/ITLN1 levels in plasma of lean/overweight/obese women with polycystic ovary syndrome.

Data suggest plasma chemerin is down-regulated in third trimester in women with gestational diabetes and remains low 3-4 months following delivery even though glucose tolerance is normalized; plasma chemerin is up-regulated in normal pregnant women.
Chemerin functions in host defense as a broad spectrum antimicrobial protein against bacteria and fungi and as a leukocyte attractant for macrophages.

Chemerin, which plays a role in inflammation and atherosclerosis, was higher in non-dippers compared to dippers and normotensives.

Chemerin significantly decreased TNF-alpha-induced NF-kappaB and VCAM-1 in human umbilical vein endothelial cell
Study demonstrated that circulating chemerin plasma levels are high in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
plasma chemerin is associated with systemic markers of inflammation and components of the metabolic syndrome.
lower chemerin appears to be an important hormone involved in cardiometabolic risk and glucose-stimulated insulin secretion reduction following exercise in older adults
An increase of chemerin levels in patients with multiple sclerosis is associated with overweight and obesity.
Chemerin is associated with endothelial activation and atherosclerosis in rheumatoid arthritis.
The study for the first time confirmed a marked expression of chemerin and CMKLR1 in the liver of chronic hepatitis patients.

Stimulation of mesenchymal stromal cells (MSCs) by chemerin increases phosphorylation of p42/44, p38 and JNK-II kinases and inhibitors of these kinases and PKC reverse chemerin-stimulated MSC migration.

results suggest that high plasma chemerin levels are associated with long-term poor prognosis and survival of gastric cancer as well as may play a role as prognostic biomarker in gastric cancer survival.

Studied levels of salivary visfatin, chemerin, and progranulin and in gingivitis, periodontitis, as well as healthy patients. Salivary progranulin levels were similar in all groups; chemerin was detected at higher levels in the periodontitis group compared to the gingivitis and the healthy groups; visfatin levels were higher in patients with gingivitis and periodontitis compared to those of healthy subjects.

It also increased expression of the cytoskeletal protein vimentin, implicating hypothalamic remodeling in this response.Acute ICV bolus injection of chemerin on a 12 h:12 h photoperiod inhibited food intake and decreased body weight with associated changes in hypothalamic neuropeptides involved in growth and feeding after 24 hr.

High chemerin expression is associated with Overweight/obese.
results show that chemerin not only increases osteoclasts activity in vitro, but also that increased level of chemerin in dyslipidemic mice plays a critical role in bone homeostasis.

RARRES2 overexpression in adrenocortical carcinoma cells inhibited Wnt/beta-catenin pathway activity by promoting beta-catenin phosphorylation and degradation, it also inhibited the phosphorylation of p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase. Thus our study identifies RARRES2 as a novel tumor suppressor for adrenocortical carcinoma, which can function through an immune-independent mechanism.

study reveals the tumor-inhibitory effect of chemerin by suppressing inflammatory tumor microenvironment with therapeutic implications for inflammation-associated cancer-like Hepatocellular carcinoma.

Data suggest that, in overweight and obese subjects, weight reduction induces changes in chemerin serum levels in parallel with adiponectin plasma levels; chemerin is down-regulated and adiponectin is up-regulated in both insulin-resistant and insulin-sensitive subjects after weight reduction; however, only changes in chemerin in insulin-sensitive subjects were found to be statistically significant.

Data suggest that primary cells from papillary renal cell carcinoma secrete the chemokines IL8, CXCL16, and chemerin; these chemokines attract primary human monocytes and induce shift/transdifferentiation in monocytes toward M2 macrophage/foam cell phenotype. (IL8 = interleukin-8; CXCL16 = C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 16)

Study suggests that circulating chemerin levels were positively correlated with the percentages of Th17 and Th9 cells, while omentin levels were negatively correlated with those cell percentages in asthma. The findings are consistent with a potential regulatory function of adipokines to the immune responses in the pathogenesis of asthma.
results demonstrate a strong inverse association between serum chemerin levels and renal function.

The aims of this study were to evaluate and correlate circulating chemerin, apelin, vaspin, and omentin-1 levels in obese type 2 diabetic Egyptian patients with coronary artery stenosis (CAS), and to assess their usefulness as noninvasive diagnostic biomarkers.

Cross-sectional study provides further evidence of an inverse association between chemerin and bone health in peri/ premenopausal women, suggesting that high chemerin concentrations may minimize the peak bone mass and thereby may promote age-related bone loss.

Data suggest that down-regulation of serum levels of chemerin (an inflammatory cytokine biomarker) can occur in weight-loss therapy as short in duration as 4-week aerobic exercise plus dieting in obese female adolescents; this effect was not observed by dieting alone. This study was conducted in weight-loss summer camp in China.

We studied the association between retinoic acid receptor responder 2 rs17173608 and rs4721 gene polymorphisms and gestational diabetes mellitus. We found that RARRES2 rs4721 polymorphism increased the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus. RARRES2 rs17173608 polymorphism is not associated with gestational diabetes mellitus.

BP.term: positive regulation of fat cell differentiation

name: retinoic acid receptor responder 2

reactome.name: Response to elevated platelet cytosolic Ca2+

summary: This gene encodes a secreted chemotactic protein that initiates chemotaxis via the ChemR23 G protein-coupled seven-transmembrane domain ligand. Expression of this gene is upregulated by the synthetic retinoid tazarotene and occurs in a wide variety of tissues. The active protein has several roles, including that as an adipokine and as an antimicrobial protein with activity against bacteria and fungi. [provided by RefSeq, Nov 2014].
